DataElement.preferredDefinition: The age (in years) at which participant had their last menstrual period.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The last age of the regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.

Concepts.definition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A period or stage in life, usually stated in years since birth.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: How long something has existed; elapsed time since birth.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
